titlStmt.titl: The contribution of databases to the results of systematic reviews: a cross-sectional study

citation.biblCit: Hartling, Lisa; Featherstone, Robin; Nuspl, Megan; Shave, Kassi; Dryden, Donna; Vandermeer, Ben, 2016, "The contribution of databases to the results of systematic reviews: a cross-sectional study", https://doi.org/10.7939/DVN/10866, UAL Dataverse, V1

titlStmt.titl: The contribution of databases to the results of systematic reviews: a cross-sectional study

distStmt.distrbtr: Alberta Research Centre for Health Evidence (ARCHE)

contact.affiliation: Alberta Research Centre for Health Evidence (ARCHE)

stdyInfo.abstract: We conducted a cross-sectional quantitative analysis to examine the impact of selective database searching on results of meta-analyses. Our sample included systematic reviews with at least one meta-analysis from three Cochrane Review Groups.

dataAccs.notes: Permission from the Alberta Research Centre for Health Evidence (ARCHE) is required to download data files for this project. Attribution is required for use of the data with the statement: The authors acknowledge the Alberta Research Centre (ARCHE) at the University of Alberta for collecting and sharing the data analyzed for this work.

citation.biblCit: Hartling L, Featherstone RM, Nuspl M, Shave K, Dryden D, & Vandermeer B. (2016). The contribution of databases to the results of systematic reviews: a cross-sectional study. BMC Medical Research Methodology. [In review].

otherMat.txt: Presence of trials in databases contributing to Cochrane meta-analyses for the Acute Respiratory Infections (ARI) review group.
Presence of trials in databases contributing to Cochrane meta-analyses for the Developmental Psychosocial and Learning Problems (DPLP) review group.
Presence of trials in databases contributing to Cochrane meta-analyses for the Infectious Diseases (ID) review group.
